name: Residenza San Pantaleo

reviews.text: I'm surprised by the most recent review but we were there in mid-September as well and had a wonderful experience.The location, right behind Piazza Navona and near the Pantheon and Campo dei Fiori, couldn't be beat. Our room was modest but comfortable, it was clean and overlooked a quiet courtyard, and the price -- 100 Euro -- was right. I would recommend this hotel. I'm just not aware of the varying sizes of the rooms. The owner let us use the Internet and also helped me with an international call using her cell phone.
reviews.title: What a great find!
Wonderful location, terrible Hotel
reviews.text: We arrived and were immediately given a sob story that our room was not available but they had another we could have at a reduced price. Little more than a closet with a bed in it. 100E is way too much for this shoebox of a room. Bed wasn't made on 1 of three days. Bathroom was an afterthought and not very clean. There are other hotels in this trendy area, keep looking.

reviews.title: Incredible location, we preferred the apartment
reviews.text: Ok, some background first. Rome was our last stop in a 1 month trip, we still had energy but were really tired of pasta, gelato, and pizza (never thought it would happen). We were initially rebooked to an apartment then a week before our arrival remodelling started on that building so they moved us again to another apartment.

In short it was great, the apartment was enough, had a nice bed, small kitchen, and small bathroom. A small patio which we sat outside and had breakfast or lunch. It is steps away from the Pantheon and has a grocery store a block away.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!
BEST EVER, FORGET THE GROUCHES!
reviews.text: They have minimal but funcitonal kitchenware so we were happy to be able to cook some food. BUT we were still travelling so we dined out quite often.

reviews.title: Great Find! We loved this place!
reviews.text: We stayed here in June of 2004 and loved this residence! I was a little weary of this accommodation since I had only read one review, but this residence turned out to be my favorite in Rome. Our room was spotlessly clean, we had a big room with a bid bed and a nice little view. I can't even begin to explain the location! We were just a two minutes walk to Piazza Navona, and an easy walk to many other of Romes highlights, and the Vatican. You must stay here if you are looking for a quiet, clean, helpful hotel at a great price. Not to mention that the breakfast came with the greatest cappucino!

reviews.title: Keep looking
reviews.text: I booked my reservations for Mid-Oct 2003 at the San Pantaleo based on price and online reviews. We were utterly disappointed with the accommodations, lack of any service, cleanliness, noise level, and 'breakfast arrangements'.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed an RSP for 5 nights. The location can't be beat for the price - you are 1 block away from P. Navonna, a few blocks away from Pantheon, Campo di Fiori, and walking distance to Trevi Fountain, and almost anything else. Breakfast is at a nice cafe/bar across the street. Room that we had was very small, small bathroom, but just enough room for the minimum amount of time you spend there. Good firm mattress, A/C worked well. But due to the setup - it is as if you have rooms in someone's large apartment, you get a lot of hallway noise, from people and manager coming and going, though surprising not a lot of outside noise considering location. Overall, I'd stay there again due to the value and location.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Value, but Noisy

reviews.text: I am giving a rating of 4 stars because the location of this hotel can't be beat. Other reviewers mentioned how you can walk to the Vatican, the Roman Forum, Coliseum, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Campo di Fiore, and the Pantheon, to name a few. It really is centrally located.
reviews.title: Great location and prices, although noisy and A/C not working
Great little B&B in the heart of old Rome
reviews.text: We stayed with two other couples. The rooms varied in size and were clean. One large room faced the street and they complained that it was very (street) noisy in the evenings, even with being up on the 4th floor. Our A/C unit did not work, and no effort was made to fix it while we were there. The lady that worked there was not able to even show me how to properly use the remote control for the A/C.

The last night we were there, we were transfered (we knew this ahead of time) to another apt. about 3 short blocks away. Also on the 4th floor, but NO elevator. We hauled our luggage up 4 stories in very narrow stairs. The A/C worked great and it was a big appartment, but we had not been told about the lack of elevator.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: I would stay here again, but would insist that the A/C in my room be working. It was very hot while we were there for three days during the third week of June.
reviews.title: Our Stay

description: The San Pantaleo Residence is situated on the fourth floor of an ancient and noble building of 1800 (equipped with an elevator) in the historic centre of Rome. Each room in the residence has a shower, air-conditioning and satellite TV. Our staff will be happy to supply you with all the information you need, on guided tours to the city by luxury coach, itineraries of historical and artistic interest, restaurants, pizzerias, wineshops, and anything else you may require during your stay.
